poem:
Title: "In the Court of the Former King"

The trial, splayed  
like a broken tulip -  
Trump's unspoken words,  
a pawn's feeble bluff.  

Mocked by a jester,  
in nightly court -  
ah! did he pen  
his silence in  
crisp dollar prints?

In the stark dance  
of power and fall,  
lies the echo  
of crimes unseen,  
truths unheard,  
yet felt.
